poem:
### The Quiet Wait

In the cells' hum  
justice gathers dust;  
years stacked  
like stones in a brook,  
innocence held  
by the thin thread  
of patience.  
Guilt—a whisper  
too sweet to resist—  
echoes down  
corridors of delay,  
where time stands still,  
a shadow  
stretching endlessly.
